casebody.data:
Cutting v. Carter et al.

Spring Vacation,

1809. Injunction — Waste — When Denied.† — Injunction to stay waste denied, there appearingno impediment to the action of waste at law.

The principal case is cited in Teass v. St. Albans, 88 W. Va. 19,17 S. E. Rep. 407. See monographic note on “Injunctions” appended to Claytor v. Anthony, 15 Gratt. 518.

This was a motion by Mr. Botts for an injunction to stay waste, which the Court refused, as no impediment appeared to the action of waste at law.
